March 25th, 1965
Mr. Harold E. Hill
Administrative Vice President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
Dear Harolds
Now they tell us. Our friends at C.P.I., that is, who have
just phoned to say, with considerable embarrassment, that providing
2500 copies of their Newsletter to NAEB would put their budget out
of kilter. They could, however, conveniently provide 1000 copies.
Would this number make it possible for you to service the one
or two of your divisions which would be most interested in the "use
of radio and television in P.I."?
Sorry about the Indian-gift sound of this, but I know you will
join me in full sympathy for budget problems.
Faithfully yours.
Harriet Lundgaard
Administrative Assistant
